summary: A Daily Mail article from January 29, 2020, reporting on Prince Andrew's response to accusations from US prosecutors that he provided 'zero co-operation' with the FBI's Jeffrey Epstein investigation. The article includes statements from Andrew's friends, reactions from lawyers representing Epstein's victims, and commentary on the royal family's crisis.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.role: Duke of York, accused of non-cooperation with FBI investigation
persons.context: Prince Andrew is accused by US prosecutors of failing to cooperate with the FBI's Epstein investigation, but his friends claim he is 'more than happy to talk' and hasn't been approached yet.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Disgraced financier and convicted sex offender
persons.context: Epstein is the central figure in the sex trafficking investigation; he killed himself in 2019 while in custody.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.context: Accused Prince Andrew of 'zero co-operation' with the FBI and US prosecutors' investigation into Epstein.

persons.name: Virginia Roberts
persons.role: Accuser claiming to be sex trafficking victim
persons.context: Claims she was instructed to have sex with Prince Andrew on three occasions from age 17, which he denies.

persons.name: Lisa Bloom
persons.role: Lawyer representing five of Epstein's victims
persons.context: Criticized Prince Andrew's lack of cooperation and suggested a 'swap' with Anne Sacoolas to secure his cooperation.

persons.name: Emily Maitlis
persons.context: Conducted the disastrous November 2019 interview with Prince Andrew about his friendship with Epstein.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.role: Lawyer for five of Epstein's accusers
persons.context: Threatened Prince Andrew with a subpoena if he ever visited the US again, criticizing his lack of response.

persons.name: Anne Sacoolas
persons.role: American involved in fatal UK car crash
persons.context: Reportedly admitted to causing the death of Harry Dunn in a crash; her potential extradition is suggested as leverage for Prince Andrew's cooperation.

persons.name: Harry Dunn
persons.context: 19-year-old killed in a crash involving Anne Sacoolas outside RAF Croughton in August 2019.

persons.name: Dominic Raab
persons.context: Prepared to raise disappointment over the Sacoolas case with US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo.

persons.name: Mike Pompeo
persons.context: Reportedly turned down an extradition request for Anne Sacoolas.

persons.name: Queen Elizabeth II
persons.context: Described as relying on Prince Andrew behind the scenes and being impacted by the scandal.

persons.name: Sebastian Shakespeare
persons.context: Author of a commentary piece included in the article criticizing Prince Andrew.

persons.name: Jan Moir
persons.context: Author of a commentary piece included in the article analyzing Prince Andrew's situation.

persons.name: Rebecca English
persons.context: Co-author of the Daily Mail article.

persons.name: Sam Greenhill
persons.context: Co-author of the Daily Mail article.

persons.name: Claire Duffin
persons.context: Co-author of a section within the article about Anne Sacoolas.

persons.name: Andy Dolan
persons.context: Co-author of a section within the article about Anne Sacoolas.

persons.name: Charlotte Charles
persons.context: Mother of the teenager killed in the crash; her friend commented on the case.

persons.name: Redd Seiger
persons.role: Friend and neighbor of Charlotte Charles
persons.context: Spoke about the need for Anne Sacoolas to return to the UK and linked it to Prince Andrew's cooperation.

connections.description: Prince Andrew had a friendship with Epstein, which continued after Epstein's conviction for child sex abuse.
Virginia Roberts claims she was instructed to have sex with Prince Andrew on three occasions from age 17; he denies ever meeting her.
Berman, as a prosecutor, accused Andrew of non-cooperation with the Epstein investigation.
Bloom, as a lawyer for Epstein's victims, criticized Andrew's lack of cooperation and suggested linking his case to Anne Sacoolas's extradition.
The Queen is Andrew's mother and is described as relying on him behind the scenes.
Sacoolas reportedly admitted to being on the wrong side of the road when she hit and killed Harry Dunn.

events.title: US Prosecutor Accuses Prince Andrew of Non-Cooperation
events.description: New York state attorney Geoffrey Berman publicly accused Prince Andrew of providing 'zero co-operation' with the FBI's Epstein investigation.

events.title: Prince Andrew's BBC Newsnight Interview
events.description: Prince Andrew gave a disastrous interview to BBC Newsnight's Emily Maitlis, failing to express regret for his friendship with Epstein and later stating he would cooperate with investigators.

events.title: Harry Dunn Fatal Crash
events.description: Anne Sacoolas, reportedly on the wrong side of the road, hit and killed 19-year-old Harry Dunn outside RAF Croughton in Northamptonshire.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein's Death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein killed himself while in custody awaiting trial on sex trafficking charges.

events.title: Alleged Sexual Encounters with Virginia Roberts
events.description: Virginia Roberts claims she was instructed to have sex with Prince Andrew on three occasions during this period, which he denies.

keyFacts: US prosecutor Geoffrey Berman publicly accused Prince Andrew of 'zero co-operation' with the FBI's investigation into Jeffrey Epstein.
Prince Andrew, through friends, denied snubbing the FBI, claiming he was 'more than happy to talk' but hadn't been approached yet.
Lawyer Lisa Bloom suggested a 'swap' where the US would extradite Anne Sacoolas to the UK in exchange for Prince Andrew's cooperation with the FBI.
The article references Virginia Roberts' allegation that she was forced to have sex with Prince Andrew three times from age 17, which he denies.
The scandal is portrayed as causing a major crisis for the British royal family, with the Queen reportedly relying on Andrew behind the scenes.
